hypothesis_content.title: CPI Surprise Amplification with ETF Flow Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: When CPI prints >0.2% away from consensus (either direction) during NEUTRAL regime, the initial 30-minute BTC price move will be amplified by 1.5-2x over the next 2 hours IF spot BTC ETF flows show divergence from the initial reaction direction.
hypothesis_content.rationale: CPI surprises create initial knee-jerk reactions that often overcorrect. Divergent ETF flows indicate institutional positioning contrary to retail sentiment, creating amplification potential as flows catch up. Recent CPI print (2.7% vs expectations) showed this pattern.
entry_conditions: CPI release prints >0.2% away from consensus (e.g., 2.5% vs 2.7% expected)
BTC has >1.5% absolute move in first 30 minutes post-release
Hourly ETF flow data (first hour after release) shows opposite sign to price move (e.g., price up but net outflows)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 2-hour window close OR price reaches 1.8x initial move magnitude
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses beyond 0.5x initial move magnitude

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of qualifying events show amplification <1.3x OR price reversal within 1 hour in backtest
